CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: From the onset oxidation potentials ( E onset ox ) and the onset reduction potentials ( E onset red ) of the polymers , the HOMO and LUMO energy levels as well as the energy gap of the polymers were calculated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) redox couple ( 4.80 eV below the vacuum level ) as an external standard. 38-40 The HOMO energy levels of P1-P7 were determined to be -5. and LUMO energy levels , all polymers have enough driving force for efficient exciton dissociation with fullerene derivatives and they are all stable in air. 38 In Table 2 , E g CV was slightly larger than E g OPT in all polymers due to the exciton binding energy of the organic conjugated materials. 41,42 Photovoltaic Properties and Theoretical Calculations. The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor. To optimize the morphology and ordering structure , different volume percentages of 1,8diiodooctane were added. 43 Figure 4 shows the current density versus voltage ( J-V ) curves for the devices under AM 1.5 illumination at 100 mW / cm^2. The V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE values of the PSC devices are summarized in Table 3. From P1 to P4 , PC71BM was used as an electron acceptor , but for P5 , P6 , and P7 , PC61BM was used as the electron acceptor. P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM. 44 The V OC of these random terpolymers increased in the order P2 ( 0.74 V ) ∼ P3 ( 0.74 V ) < P4 ( 0.76 V ) < P5 ( 0.79 V ) < P6 ( 0.82 V ). The trend in the V OC of the PSCs can be explained by the HOMO energy level of the polymers because the V OC is typically linearly proportional to the difference in energy between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor. 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC . P3 exhibited the highest PCE value of 5.61% among all polymers , including P1 and P7 , which was attributed to the broad absorption and increased V OC due to the deeper HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Fc/Fc+ |
| P1 |
| P2 |
| P3 |
| P4 |
| P5 |
| P6 |
| P7 |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |
| ITO |
| PEDOT:PSS |
| 1,8-diiodooctane |
| LiF |
| Al |

Note: The material names are presented precisely as they appear in the original paragraph, with no corrections or adjustments made to the capitalization or punctuation.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Fc/Fc+ |
| P1 |
| P2 |
| P3 |
| P4 |
| P5 |
| P6 |
| P7 |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |

Note: The entities that were removed were "ITO", "PEDOT:PSS", "1,8-diiodooctane", "LiF", and "Al" as they do not clearly refer to material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: From the onset oxidation potentials ( E onset ox ) and the onset reduction potentials ( E onset red ) of the polymers , the HOMO and LUMO energy levels as well as the energy gap of the polymers were calculated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) redox couple ( 4.80 eV below the vacuum level ) as an external standard. 38-40 The HOMO energy levels of P1-P7 were determined to be -5. and LUMO energy levels , all polymers have enough driving force for efficient exciton dissociation with fullerene derivatives and they are all stable in air. 38 In Table 2 , E g CV was slightly larger than E g OPT in all polymers due to the exciton binding energy of the organic conjugated materials. 41,42 Photovoltaic Properties and Theoretical Calculations. The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor. To optimize the morphology and ordering structure , different volume percentages of 1,8diiodooctane were added. 43 Figure 4 shows the current density versus voltage ( J-V ) curves for the devices under AM 1.5 illumination at 100 mW / cm^2. The V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE values of the PSC devices are summarized in Table 3. From P1 to P4 , PC71BM was used as an electron acceptor , but for P5 , P6 , and P7 , PC61BM was used as the electron acceptor. P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM. 44 The V OC of these random terpolymers increased in the order P2 ( 0.74 V ) ∼ P3 ( 0.74 V ) < P4 ( 0.76 V ) < P5 ( 0.79 V ) < P6 ( 0.82 V ). The trend in the V OC of the PSCs can be explained by the HOMO energy level of the polymers because the V OC is typically linearly proportional to the difference in energy between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor. 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC . P3 exhibited the highest PCE value of 5.61% among all polymers , including P1 and P7 , which was attributed to the broad absorption and increased V OC due to the deeper HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| E onset ox |
| E onset red |
| HOMO energy levels |
| LUMO energy levels |
| Energy gap |
| E g CV |
| E g OPT |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |
| PCE |

Note:

* E onset ox and E onset red refer to the onset oxidation potentials and onset reduction potentials of the polymers, respectively.
* HOMO and LUMO energy levels refer to the highest occupied molecular orbital and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital energy levels of the polymers, respectively.
* Energy gap refers to the energy difference between the HOMO and LUMO energy levels.
* E g CV and E g OPT refer to the energy gaps calculated using the cyclic voltammetry and optical spectroscopy methods, respectively.
* V OC, J SC, FF, and PCE refer to the open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current, fill factor, and power conversion efficiency of the photovoltaic devices, respectively.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| LUMO energy levels |
| Energy gap |

| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |
| PCE |

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: From the onset oxidation potentials ( E onset ox ) and the onset reduction potentials ( E onset red ) of the polymers , the HOMO and LUMO energy levels as well as the energy gap of the polymers were calculated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) redox couple ( 4.80 eV below the vacuum level ) as an external standard. 38-40 The HOMO energy levels of P1-P7 were determined to be -5. and LUMO energy levels , all polymers have enough driving force for efficient exciton dissociation with fullerene derivatives and they are all stable in air. 38 In Table 2 , E g CV was slightly larger than E g OPT in all polymers due to the exciton binding energy of the organic conjugated materials. 41,42 Photovoltaic Properties and Theoretical Calculations. The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor. To optimize the morphology and ordering structure , different volume percentages of 1,8diiodooctane were added. 43 Figure 4 shows the current density versus voltage ( J-V ) curves for the devices under AM 1.5 illumination at 100 mW / cm^2. The V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE values of the PSC devices are summarized in Table 3. From P1 to P4 , PC71BM was used as an electron acceptor , but for P5 , P6 , and P7 , PC61BM was used as the electron acceptor. P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM. 44 The V OC of these random terpolymers increased in the order P2 ( 0.74 V ) ∼ P3 ( 0.74 V ) < P4 ( 0.76 V ) < P5 ( 0.79 V ) < P6 ( 0.82 V ). The trend in the V OC of the PSCs can be explained by the HOMO energy level of the polymers because the V OC is typically linearly proportional to the difference in energy between the HOMO of the polymer and the LUMO of the acceptor. 45 However , the PCE of the random terpolymers showed a the nonlinear compositional dependence from 2 to 6% in the order P3 ( 5.61% ) > P4 ( 5.26% ) > P2 ( 4.91% ) > P5 ( 3.02% ) > P6 ( 2.09% ) ; this was consistent with the observed trend of the J SC . P3 exhibited the highest PCE value of 5.61% among all polymers , including P1 and P7 , which was attributed to the broad absorption and increased V OC due to the deeper HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| E<sub>onset ox</sub> | Oxidation potential of the polymers |
| E<sub>onset red</sub> | Reduction potential of the polymers |
| E<sub>g</sub> | Energy gap of the polymers |
| E<sub>g,CV</sub> | Energy gap obtained from cyclic voltammetry |
| E<sub>g,OPT</sub> | Energy gap obtained from optical absorption spectroscopy |
| HOMO energy level | Energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital |
| LUMO energy level | Energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital |
| V<sub>OC</sub> | Open-circuit voltage of the photovoltaic cells |
| J<sub>SC</sub> | Short-circuit current density of the photovoltaic cells |
| FF | Fill factor of the photovoltaic cells |
| PCE | Power conversion efficiency of the photovoltaic cells |
| 1,8-diiodooctane | Volume percentage of 1,8-diiodooctane added to optimize morphology and ordering structure |
| 4.80 eV | Energy difference between the HOMO energy level of the polymers and the vacuum level |
| 100 mW/cm<sup>2</sup> | Illumination intensity under AM 1.5 illumination |

Note: The values of the material properties are not explicitly stated in the given paragraph, but they can be inferred from the context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| E<sub>g</sub> | Energy gap of the polymers |
| E<sub>g,CV</sub> | Energy gap obtained from cyclic voltammetry |
| E<sub>g,OPT</sub> | Energy gap obtained from optical absorption spectroscopy |
| HOMO energy level | Energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital |
| LUMO energy level | Energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital |
| V<sub>OC</sub> | Open-circuit voltage of the photovoltaic cells |

Note: The other mentioned properties, such as J<sub>SC</sub>, FF, and PCE, are not directly related to the material properties of the polymers and are therefore not included in the table.
